questions.title: What operator is used to compare two values?
How do you insert a comment in Python?
How do you define a function in Python?
How are class functions typically defined in Python?
Which of the following is a correct if statement in Python?
Which of the following is a correct while loop in Python?
How do you write an indexed for loop in Python?
In Python, a control structure:
options: Determines the order of execution of the statements in a program
Controls file input and output operations
questions.correctAnswer: Determines the order of execution of the statements in a program

questions.title: What signifies the end of a statement block in Python?
options: A line that is indented less than the previous line
questions.correctAnswer: A line that is indented less than the previous line

questions.title: In the statement x = a + 5 - b, what are a and b?
What does the % operator do in Python?
options: Returns the floating-point division of two operands
Returns the integer division of two operands
Returns the multiplication of two operands
Returns the remainder of dividing two operands
questions.correctAnswer: Returns the remainder of dividing two operands

questions.title: Which of the following statements about lists are true?
options: A list can contain any type of object except another list
A list can have duplicate elements
The size of a list can't be changed
questions.correctAnswer: A list can have duplicate elements

questions.title:
How can you replace the first element in the tuple
t = ('a', 'b')?
Which of the following is not a valid variable name in Python?

What will the following code output?
# print(10 % 2)

How many times will the following for loop run?
for x in range(10):
Assume a 'Car' class exists, how do you create a new 'Car' object in Python?

Assume you have a class with an __init__() function.
When will the __init__() function run?
options: Whenever a new instance of that class is created
At the start of every program
At the end of every program
questions.correctAnswer: Whenever a new instance of that class is created

questions.title: When does an 'else' statement execute?
options: When all preceding conditions are false
When all preceding conditions before it are true
questions.correctAnswer: When all preceding conditions are false
